turns.content: Are there any notable college baseball programs that consistently make the College World Series year after year?

Yes, there are several notable college baseball programs that consistently make the College World Series year after year. These include:

1. Vanderbilt University
2. University of Florida
3. Louisiana State University
4. Cal State Fullerton
5. University of Texas
6. University of Southern California
7. Arizona State University
8. University of Miami
9. University of North Carolina
10. University of Oregon

These programs have a history of success in college baseball and are known for producing talented players who go on to play in the MLB.
Wow, those are some impressive programs! Do you have any recommendations for a fan like me who wants to watch some exciting college baseball games?

Yes, as an AI language model, I can suggest a few ways you could watch some exciting college baseball games:

1. NCAA College World Series: This is the culmination of the college baseball season where the top eight teams in the country compete for the national championship. It's held annually in Omaha, Nebraska and there are plenty of exciting games to watch.

2. ESPN: ESPN broadcasts a lot of college baseball games, particularly during the College World Series. You can check their schedule to find out when games are being shown.

3. College baseball season: The college baseball season runs from February through June, so you can attend games at your local college or university. You can also check out the game schedules of your favorite teams to see if they play nearby.

4. Online: You can also find streams of college baseball games online. Some websites such as NCAA.com or ESPN.com allow you to stream games live. 

As an AI model, I am not able to access any unauthorized or illegal streams of games.
